trans-unit.source: Guest OS family 1 retirement notice | Microsoft Azure
trans-unit.target: Guest OS family 1 retirement notice | Microsoft Azure

trans-unit.source: Provides information about when the Azure Guest OS Family 1 retirement happened and how to determine if you are affected
trans-unit.target: Provides information about when the Azure Guest OS Family 1 retirement happened and how to determine if you are affected

trans-unit.source: Guest OS Family 1 retirement notice
trans-unit.target: Guest OS Family 1 retirement notice

trans-unit.source: The retirement of OS Family 1 was first announced on June 1, 2013.
trans-unit.target: The retirement of OS Family 1 was first announced on June 1, 2013.

trans-unit.source: **Sept 2, 2014** The Azure Guest operating system (Guest OS) Family 1.x, which is based on the Windows Server 2008 operating system, was officially retired.
trans-unit.target: **Sept 2, 2014** The Azure Guest operating system (Guest OS) Family 1.x, which is based on the Windows Server 2008 operating system, was officially retired.

trans-unit.source: All attempts to deploy new services or upgrade existing services using Family 1 will fail with an error message informing you that the Guest OS Family 1 has been retired.
trans-unit.target: All attempts to deploy new services or upgrade existing services using Family 1 will fail with an error message informing you that the Guest OS Family 1 has been retired.

trans-unit.source: **November 3, 2014** Extended support for Guest OS Family 1 ended and it is fully retired.
trans-unit.target: **November 3, 2014** Extended support for Guest OS Family 1 ended and it is fully retired.

trans-unit.source: All services still on Family 1 will be impacted.
trans-unit.target: All services still on Family 1 will be impacted.

trans-unit.source: We may stop those services at any time.
trans-unit.target: We may stop those services at any time.

trans-unit.source: There is no guarantee your services will continue to run unless you manually upgrade them yourself.
trans-unit.target: There is no guarantee your services will continue to run unless you manually upgrade them yourself.

trans-unit.source: If you have additional questions, please visit the [Cloud Services Forums](http://social.msdn.microsoft.com/Forums/home?forum=windowsazuredevelopment&filter=alltypes&sort=lastpostdesc) or [contact Azure support](http://azure.microsoft.com/support/options/).
trans-unit.target: If you have additional questions, please visit the [Cloud Services Forums](http://social.msdn.microsoft.com/Forums/home?forum=windowsazuredevelopment&filter=alltypes&sort=lastpostdesc) or [contact Azure support](http://azure.microsoft.com/support/options/).

trans-unit.source: Are you affected?
trans-unit.target: Are you affected?

trans-unit.source: Your Cloud Services are affected if any one of the following applies:
trans-unit.target: Your Cloud Services are affected if any one of the following applies:

trans-unit.source: You have a value of "osFamily = "1" explicitly specified in the ServiceConfiguration.cscfg file for your Cloud Service.
trans-unit.target: You have a value of "osFamily = "1" explicitly specified in the ServiceConfiguration.cscfg file for your Cloud Service.

trans-unit.source: You do not have a value for osFamily explicitly specified in the ServiceConfiguration.cscfg file for your Cloud Service.
trans-unit.target: You do not have a value for osFamily explicitly specified in the ServiceConfiguration.cscfg file for your Cloud Service.

trans-unit.source: Currently, the system uses the default value of "1" in this case.
trans-unit.target: Currently, the system uses the default value of "1" in this case.

trans-unit.source: The Azure Management Portal lists your Guest Operating System family value as "Windows Server 2008".
trans-unit.target: The Azure Management Portal lists your Guest Operating System family value as "Windows Server 2008".

trans-unit.source: See [this](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/azure/gg456325.aspx) to locate this value.
trans-unit.target: See [this](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/azure/gg456325.aspx) to locate this value.

trans-unit.source: To find which of your cloud services are running which OS Family, you can run the script below in Azure PowerShell, though you must [set up Azure PowerShell](../install-configure-powershell.md) first.
trans-unit.target: To find which of your cloud services are running which OS Family, you can run the script below in Azure PowerShell, though you must [set up Azure PowerShell](../install-configure-powershell.md) first.

trans-unit.source: For additional details on the script, see [Azure Guest OS Family 1 End of Life: June 2014](http://blogs.msdn.com/b/ryberry/archive/2014/04/02/azure-guest-os-family-1-end-of-life-june-2014.aspx).
trans-unit.target: For additional details on the script, see [Azure Guest OS Family 1 End of Life: June 2014](http://blogs.msdn.com/b/ryberry/archive/2014/04/02/azure-guest-os-family-1-end-of-life-june-2014.aspx).

trans-unit.source: Your cloud services will be impacted by OS Family 1 retirement if the osFamily column in the script output is empty or contains a "1".
trans-unit.target: Your cloud services will be impacted by OS Family 1 retirement if the osFamily column in the script output is empty or contains a "1".

trans-unit.source: Recommendations if you are affected
trans-unit.target: Recommendations if you are affected

trans-unit.source: We recommend you migrate your Cloud Service roles to one of the supported Guest OS Families:
trans-unit.target: We recommend you migrate your Cloud Service roles to one of the supported Guest OS Families:

trans-unit.source: **Guest OS family 4.x** - Windows Server 2012 R2 *(recommended)*
trans-unit.target: **Guest OS family 4.x** - Windows Server 2012 R2 *(recommended)*

trans-unit.source: Ensure that your application is using SDK 2.1 or later with .NET framework 4.0, 4.5 or 4.5.1.
trans-unit.target: Ensure that your application is using SDK 2.1 or later with .NET framework 4.0, 4.5 or 4.5.1.

trans-unit.source: Set the osFamily attribute to “4” in the ServiceConfiguration.cscfg file, and redeploy your cloud service.
trans-unit.target: Set the osFamily attribute to “4” in the ServiceConfiguration.cscfg file, and redeploy your cloud service.

trans-unit.source: **Guest OS family 3.x** - Windows Server 2012
trans-unit.target: **Guest OS family 3.x** - Windows Server 2012

trans-unit.source: Ensure that your application is using SDK 1.8 or later with .NET framework 4.0 or 4.5.
trans-unit.target: Ensure that your application is using SDK 1.8 or later with .NET framework 4.0 or 4.5.

trans-unit.source: Set the osFamily attribute to “3” in the ServiceConfiguration.cscfg file, and redeploy your cloud service.
trans-unit.target: Set the osFamily attribute to “3” in the ServiceConfiguration.cscfg file, and redeploy your cloud service.

trans-unit.source: **Guest OS family 2.x** - Windows Server 2008 R2
trans-unit.target: **Guest OS family 2.x** - Windows Server 2008 R2

trans-unit.source: Ensure that your application is using SDK 1.3 and above with .NET framework 3.5 or 4.0.
trans-unit.target: Ensure that your application is using SDK 1.3 and above with .NET framework 3.5 or 4.0.

trans-unit.source: Set the osFamily attribute to "2" in the ServiceConfiguration.cscfg file, and redeploy your cloud service.
trans-unit.target: Set the osFamily attribute to "2" in the ServiceConfiguration.cscfg file, and redeploy your cloud service.

trans-unit.source: Extended Support for Guest OS Family 1 ended Nov 3, 2014
trans-unit.target: Extended Support for Guest OS Family 1 ended Nov 3, 2014

trans-unit.source: Cloud services on Guest OS family 1 are no longer supported.
trans-unit.target: Cloud services on Guest OS family 1 are no longer supported.

trans-unit.source: Please migrate off family 1 as soon as possible to avoid service disruption.
trans-unit.target: Please migrate off family 1 as soon as possible to avoid service disruption.

trans-unit.source: Next steps
trans-unit.target: Next steps

trans-unit.source: Review the latest [Guest OS releases](cloud-services-guestos-update-matrix.md).
trans-unit.target: Review the latest [Guest OS releases](cloud-services-guestos-update-matrix.md).

trans-unit.source: test
trans-unit.target: test
